ovdesc.p: Transaction charges can be either set up to be calculated when a transaction is booked (CHARGE.PERIOD is set to "T") or when charges
are capitalised (CHARGE.PERIOD is blank).

The amount per entry, Free Amount, Minimum Amount and Maximum Amount may be defined for specified Currencies. Default Amounts in local currency equivalent are used for accounts in currencies for which no amounts are specified.
All Account Maintenance Charges are applied on the charge capitalisation date as specified in CHARGE.CALCULATION on the COMPANY record, (monthly, quarterly, six monthly or annually).

For "T" type charges the parameter records (TRANSACTION, GENERAL.CHARGE and TRANSACTION.CHARGE) relevant to the time of booking will be used. If a parameter record is changed previously booked charges will not be affected. However the REBUILD.TRAN.CHARGES table can be used to trigger a rebuild of transaction charges using the parameter records relevant to the rebuild date.

If transaction charges are set to be calculated at the charge capitalisation date then the parameter records relevant to the charge capitalisation date will apply to all relevant transactions booked during the charge capitalisation period.
For transaction charges to apply to a customer account then 2 conditions must occur:
The account must be linked to a GENERAL.CHARGE record set for transaction charges.
TRANSACTION record(s) must set up for transaction charges.
The GENERAL.CHARGE table is linked to an account via GROUP.DEBIT.INT or ACCOUNT.DEBIT.INT and is set up for transaction charges as follows:
TRANS.CODE.CHARGE set to "Y" indicates that transaction charges are to be applied for this general charge type.

COMB.TRNS.CDE Indicates the transaction charge record used to apply free, minimum and maximum amounts against transaction charge totals. The PL category for charge postings will be picked up from the relevant TRANSACTION.CHARGE record defined here. The PL categories for individual transaction code totals will be blanked on the STMT.ACCT.CH record.

CHARGE.CODE.LEVEL determines whether all charges are combined or the free minimum and maximum amounts are applied to each major charge type. Setting this to "IND" will apply the free minimum and maximum amounts to the transaction charge total. Setting it to "COM" indicates that Transaction Charges should be combined into one entry with other account maintenance charges, which can include; BALANCE.REQUIREMENT, NUMBER.OF.CREDITS or TURNOVER.CREDIT NUMBER.OF.DEBITS or TURNOVER.DEBIT.
The TRANSACTION table is linked to transaction charges as follows:
IMMEDIATE.CHARGE has to be set to NO to activate transaction charges.
CHARGE.KEY links to TRANSACTION.CHARGE via TRANSACTION.CHARGE.XREF
for example;
1 - would link to TRANSACTION.CHARGE record 1 “.” effective date via TRANSACTION.CHARGE.XREF
1.2 would link to a TRANSACTION CHARGE record 1 “.” Effective date “.” 2 (where 2 relates to a specific general charge record).
The TRANSACTION.CHARGE.XREF table stores the effective dates relating to TRANSACTION.CHARGE records
The key contains the sequence number and an optional GENERAL.CHARGE key
The record contains the effective dates for the charges.

If the GENERAL.CHARGE relevant to the customer account and TRANSACTION relevant to the transaction code in an accounting entry are both set up for transaction charges the relevant TRANSACTION.CHARGE record will be determined and if it has the CHARGE.PERIOD set to "T" the transaction charge will be calculated when a transaction is booked. ACCR.ACCT.TRAN.CH will be updated with the charge data. The mimimum maximum and free amounts will not apply to individual charges calculated when a transaction is booked. It is possible to set more than one transaction charge per transaction.
Examples:
In all cases where records have effective dates in the key the record selected will be the one with the date closest to but not greater than the charge calculation date.
GENERAL.CHARGE 1 and 3 set for transaction charges 2 is not
TRANS.CODE.CHARGE = "Y"
TRANSACTION 213 set up for transaction charges as follows
IMMEDIATE.CHARGE = "NO"
CHARGE.KEY set to 1.2 1.3 1
ACCOUNTS
12345 linked to GENERAL.CHARGE type 3.
23456 linked to GENERAL.CHARGE type 5.
45678 linked to GENERAL.CHARGE type 2.
An entry is booked to each account with a transaction code of 213.
The relevant TRANSACTION.CHARGE records will be as follows
12345 - 1.YYYYMMDD.3
23456 - 1.YYYYMMDD
45678 - no charges apply
Using the above example but TRANSACTION 213 has CHARGE.KEY set to 1.2 1.3 1 2
2 charges will apply to the transaction from the TRANSACTION.CHARGE records
12345 - 1.YYYYMMDD.3 and 2.YYYYMMDD
23456 - 1.YYYYMMDD and 2.YYYYMMDD
45678 - no charges apply

desc.p: Specifies the rate used to calculate the charge amount for an entry as a Percentage of the entry value.
Up to 10 type R characters plus a decimal point, (standard rate format). (Optional input if the Field 8 is blank, otherwise not allowed.)
Not more than 6 integers may be entered.
Not more than 9 decimals may be entered.
Identifies the Transaction Code to be assigned to Account entries generated for Transaction Charges.
1-10(Max Value) numeric characters Transaction Code. (Mandatory Input)
The Maximum value is specified in EB.OBJECT for TRANSACTION.
It must be a valid code on the TRANSACTION (ref: General Tables) table.
The Debit Credit Indicator in the Transaction record must be DEBIT.
Specifies the Minimum Amount, in local currency equivalent, to be charged to the Account, if there are no details in Fields 12-16 for the Currency of the Account.

Amounts for calculating Transaction Charges in specific Currencies can be specified in the multivalue associated group of Fields 12-16. The Default Amounts specified in Fields 8-11 are used if there are no details in Fields 12-16 for the Currency of the Account.
If PERCENTAGE (Field 7) is specified, the calculated amount is converted to local currency before making adjustments specified in Fields 9-11.

If after the DEFAULT FREE AMT (Field 9) has been subtracted from the calculated local currency charge, the result is less than the DEFAULT MIN AMT (Field 10), the Default Minimum Amount is used. Otherwise the DEFAULT MAX AMT (Field 11) is checked. The result is converted to the Currency of the Account.

The COMPANY record specifies when the charges are to be applied. If, however, the associated GENERAL.CHARGE record specifies that charges should be calculated on a monthly basis (Calcul Step Period = M), the charge for each month is compared with the Minimum Amount and adjusted if necessary.
1-14 numeric characters plus a decimal point. (Optional input, default is zero). The number of decimals may not exceed the number for local currency.
Specifies the Maximum Amount to be charged to the Account, for Accounts in the Currency specified in the associated Field 12.

Fields 12-16 are used to define Amounts for calculating Transaction Charges in specific Currencies. The Default Amounts specified in Fields 8-11 are used if there are no details in Fields 12-16 for the Currency of the Account.
If after the Free Amount has been subtracted from the calculated charge the result is greater than the Maximum Amount, the Maximum Amount is used.

The COMPANY record specifies when the charges are to be applied. If, however, the associated GENERAL.CHARGE record specifies that charges should be calculated on a monthly basis (Calcul Step Period = M), the charge for each month is compared with the Maximum Amount and adjusted if necessary.

1-14 numeric characters plus a decimal point. Multivalue field associated with Fields 12-15. (Optional input. Only allowed if Field 12 is input). The number of decimals may not exceed the number of CURRENCY in Field 12.
This is a code and effective date which identifies the Transaction Charge.
When a charge is calculated the TRANSACTION.CHARGE record with an effective date closest to but not greater than the charge calculation date will be used.
Note: Altering an existing Transaction Charge record does not cause any adjustment to charges already processed.

a) 1-3 numeric character Transaction Charge code. b) '-' (Mandatory if date entered, otherwise not input). Prime Sites '.' c) 1-9 Date characters. (Optional input. Default value is today's date.) (Mandatory input)
The date must be later than or equal to today.
If year or month is not entered, the current year or month is assumed.
Describes the Transaction Charge, and can be used for reporting.
The Description may be entered in each of the Languages defined in the LANGUAGE table (ref: General Tables).
It will be displayed in the Language specified in the User Record of the person using the System.
3-35 type A (alphanumeric) characters. Multilanguage field. (Mandatory input)
Specifies the amount to be deducted from the total charge calculated, subject to the Minimum and Maximum charge values, for Accounts in the Currency specified in the associated Field 12.

Fields 12-16 are used to define Amounts for calculating Transaction Charges in specific Currencies. The Default Amounts specified in Fields 8-11 are used if there are no details in Fields 12-16 for the Currency of the Account.
The Free Amount is subtracted from the calcualted charge and further adjustments are made as specified in Fields 15 and 16.

The COMPANY record specifies when the charges are to be applied. If, however, the associated GENERAL.CHARGE record specifies that charges should be calculated on a monthly basis (Calcul Step Period = M), the Free Amount is subtracted from the charge calculated for each month. Note: (i) The result may be zero, but not negative, i.e. the Customer will not receive a Credit.
(ii) Even if the FREE AMOUNT (Field 14) is greater than the calculated charge, any Minimum specified in Field 15, MINIMUM AMOUNT, is still applicable.

1-14 numeric characters plus a decimal point. Multivalue field associated with Fields 12,13,15 and 16. (Optional input only allowed if Field 12 is input). The number of decimals may not exceed the number for CURRENCY in Field 12.
The id comprises of a sequence no., an effective date and an optional general charge code.
If the general charge code is used the transaction charge will be linked specifically to the accounts linked to the general charge record, otherwise it becomes generic to all general charges.
When a charge is calculated the TRANSACTION.CHARGE record with an effective date closest to but not greater than the charge calculation date will be used.
Note: Altering an existing Transaction Charge record does not cause any adjustment to charges already processed.

a) 1-3 numeric character Transaction Charge code. b) '.' (Mandatory if date entered, otherwise not input). c) 9 Date characters YYYYMMDD (Optional input. Default value is today's date.) d) '.' (Mandatory if general charge id is entered, otherwise not input). e) 1-3 numeric character General Charge code.
The date must be later than or equal to today.
If effective date is not entered, Todays date is assumed.
If the general charge code is used then it must exist on the GENERAL.CHARGE file.
Specifies the rate used to calculate the charge amount for an entry as a Percentage of the entry value.
Up to 10 type R characters plus a decimal point, (standard rate format). (Optional input if the Field 8 is blank, otherwise not allowed.)
Not more than 6 integers may be entered.
Not more than 9 decimals may be entered.

Defines the Currency for which the Transaction Charge details in the associated Fields 13-16 apply. For Accounts in Currencies with no input in this Field, the Default Amounts specified in Fields 8-11 are used.

Fields 12-16 are used to define Amounts calculating Transaction Charges on Accounts in specific Currencies. For any Accounts in Currencies not specified in Fields 12-16, the Default (local currency equivalent) Amounts specified in Fields 8-11 are used.

3 types SSS (SWIFT) characters Currency code. or 1-3 characters Numeric Currency Code (will be converted to Currency code). Multivalue Field associated with fields 13-16. (Mandatory input if any input in associatedFields 13-16, otherwise optional.) It must be a valid code on the CURRENCY table.
Specifies the Maximum Amount, in local currency equivalent, to be charged to the Account, if there are no details in Fields 12-16 for the Currency of the Account.

Amounts for calculating Transaction Charges in specific Currencies can be specified in the multivalue associated group of Fields 12-16. The Default Amounts specified in Fields 8-11 are used if there are no details in Fields 12-16 for the Currency of the Account.
If PERCENTAGE (Field 7) is specified, the calculated amount is converted to local currency before making adjustments specified in Fields 9-11.

If after the Default Free Amount has been subtracted from the calculated local currency charge, the result is greater than the Default Maximum Amount, the Default Maximum Amount is used. The result is converted to the Currency of the Account.

The COMPANY record specifies when the charges are to be applied. If, however, the associated GENERAL.CHARGE record specifies that charges should be calculated on a monthly basis (Calcul Step Period = M), the charge for each month is compared with the Maximum Amount and adjusted if necessary.
1-14 numeric characters plus a decimal point. (Optional input, default is zero). The number of decimals may not exceed the number for local currency.
Identifies the Transaction Code to be assigned to Profit and Loss entries generated for Transaction Charges.
1-10(Max Value) numeric characters Transaction Code. (Mandatory Input)
The Maximum value is specified in EB.OBJECT for TRANSACTION.
It must be a valid code on the TRANSACTION table (ref: General Tables).
The Debit Credit Indicator in the Transaction record must be CREDIT.
Identifies the Category code to be assigned to Profit and Loss entries generated for Transaction Charges.
4 or 5 numeric character Category code. (Mandatory input)
It must be a valid code on the CATEGORY table (ref: General Tables).
System Indicator in Category record must be PL.
Specifies the amount to be charged per entry (if no Percentage is specified in Field 7) for Accounts in the Currency specified in the associated Field 12.

Fields 12-16 are used to define amounts for calculating Transaction Charges in specific Currencies. The Default Amounts (in local currency) specified in Fields 8-11 are used if there are no details in Fields 12-16 for the Currency of the Account.
If no PERCENTAGE (Field 7) is specified, the amount in this Field is multiplied by the number of entries. The result is adjusted using specified in Fields 14-16.
The number of decimals may not exceed the number for Currency in Field 12.
1-14 numeric characters plus a decimal point. Multivalue Field associated with fields 12,14, 15 and 16. (Mandatory input if Field 7 is not input and Field 12 is input otherwise not allowed.)
Identifies period for calculation of Transaction charges.

T - Individual Transaction based calculations of charges calculated when a transaction is booked and used to update ACCR.ACCT.TRAN.CH, free minimum and maximum amounts are not relevant to individual charge calculations, to activate free minimum and maximum amounts the GENERAL.CHARGE record must have COMB.TRNS.CDE set (see overview)

Blank - Charges are calculated on charge capitalisation date using information from the transaction data in ACCT.ACTIVITY, any free minimum and maximum values for the charge will be applied to the total transaction charge
1 alphabetic character. Only 'T' - Individual Transaction allowed currently or blank allowed

If a valid FT.COMMISSION.TYPE record is attached then the transaction charge is taken based on the conditions specified in the FT.COMMISSION.TYPE. Category, debit-credit transaction codes defined in the TRANSACTION CHARGE is taken for processing. Default free amount in TRANSACTION.CHARGE is also used as a parameter for calculating charges.
Valid record in FT.COMMISSION.TYPE is allowed
If FT.COMMISSION.TYPE record is attached then Percentage, Default charge amount, Default minimum amount & Default maximum amount fields cannot be entered.
Specifies the Tax record containing details of the Tax applicable to the Transaction Charge.

Up to 2 numeric character Tax code. (Optional input) There must be an existing record for this code on the TAX table (ref: General Tables), with effective date less than or equal to the effective date of this record.

Specifies the Free Amount, in local currency equivalent, to be deducted from the total charge calculated, subject to the Minimum and Maximum Charge values, if there are no details in Fields 12-16 for the Currency of the Account.

Amounts for calculating Transaction Charges in specific Currencies can be specified in the multivalue associated group of Fields, 12-16. The Default Amounts specified in Fields 8-11 are used if there are no details in Fields 12-16 for the Currency of the Account.
If Percentage is specified, the calculated amount is converted to local currency before making adjustments specified in Fields 9-11.

The Default Free Amount is subtracted from the calculated local currency charge and further adjustments are made as specified in Fields 10 and 11. The result is converted to the Currency of the Account.

The COMPANY record specifies when the charges are to be applied. If, however, the associated GENERAL.CHARGE record specifies that charges should be calculated on a monthly basis (Calcul Step Period = M), the Free Amount is subtracted from the charge calcualted for each month.
Note: (i)The result may be zero, but not negative, i.e. the Customer will not receive a Credit.
(ii)Even if the FREE AMOUNT (Field 14) is greater than the calculated charge, any Minimum specified in Field 10, DEFAULT MIN AMT, is still applicable.
1-14 numeric characters plus a decimal point. (Optional input) The number of decimals may not exceed the number for local currency.
Specifies the Minimum Amount to be charged to the Account, for Accounts in the Currency specified in the associated Field 12.

Fields 12-16 are used to define Amounts for calculating Transaction Charges in specific Currencies. The Default Amounts specified in Fields 8-11 are used if there are no details in Fields 12-16 for the Currency of the Account.
If after the Free Amount has been subtracted from the calculated charge the result is less than the Minimum Amount, the Minimum Amount is used. Otherwise the Maximum is checked.

The COMPANY record specifies when the charges are to be applied. If, however, the associated GENERAL.CHARGE record specifies that charges should be calculated on a monthly basis Calcul Step Period = M), the charge for each month is compared with the Minimum Amount and adjusted if necessary.

1-14 numeric characters plus a decimal point. Multivalue Field associated with Fields 12-14 and 16. (Optional input. Only allowed if Field 12 is input. Default is zero.) The number of decimals may not exceed the number for CURRENCY in Field 12.
Specifies the amount, in local currency equivalent, to be charged per entry if no Percentage is specified in Field 7 and there are no details in Fields 12-16 for the Currency of the Account.

Amounts for calculating Transaction Charges in specific Currencies can be specified in the multivalue associated group of Fields 12-16. The Default Amounts specified in Fields 8-11 are used if there are no details in Fields 12-16 for the Currency of the Account.

If no PERCENTAGE (Field 7) is specified, the local currency amount in this field is multiplied by the number of entries. The result is adjusted using details specified in Fields 9-11 and converted to the Currency of the Account.
1-14 numeric characters plus a decimal point. (Mandatory input, not allowed if Field 7 is input). The number of decimals may not exceed the number of local currency.
